item.title: What Is Acupuncture?
item.description:
Acupuncture is a treatment method from Traditional Chinese Medicine that uses very thin, sterile needles placed at specific points on the body. The goal is to support the body’s natural healing response and restore balance across different systems.

Many people first try acupuncture for pain, but it is also commonly used for stress, sleep issues, digestive symptoms, and women’s health concerns.

What happens in a standard session?

  1. Brief check-in on current symptoms
  2. Focused assessment based on your treatment goals
  3. Needle placement at points selected for your condition
  4. Rest period, usually 20-30 minutes
  5. Follow-up recommendations before your next visit

What does treatment feel like?

Most patients feel minimal discomfort when needles are inserted. During treatment, people often report a deep sense of relaxation, warmth, or heaviness in the treated area.

item.title: Dr. Dan Wang
item.description:
Originally from Northeast China, Dan brings a rich cultural and clinical background rooted in Traditional Chinese Medicine. She earned her degree from the Liaoning University of Traditional Chinese Medicine in the 1990s and has been practicing in the western suburbs of Chicago for the past four years.

Dan is deeply passionate about Chinese medical philosophy and integrates practices such as Taiji, Yijing, and Feng Shui into her holistic approach. She believes true healing comes from achieving balance, both mentally and physically, and she works closely with each patient to support that harmony.

item.title: How Acupuncture Supports Pain Recovery
item.description:
Pain can come from overuse, injury, poor sleep, stress, or long-standing inflammation. Acupuncture supports recovery by improving local circulation, reducing muscle tension, and helping regulate pain signaling.

It is commonly used for neck and back pain, sciatica, headaches, TMJ, tendon irritation, and pain after work, sports, or motor vehicle injuries.

Common pain conditions treated

  • Neck and back pain
  • Sciatica
  • Headaches and migraines
  • Joint pain in shoulders, knees, and feet
  • Tendon irritation such as tennis elbow and plantar fasciitis

How long does it take to feel improvement?

Some patients feel relief quickly, especially with recent injuries. Chronic conditions often improve gradually over several weeks with consistent treatment.

item.title: What to Expect at Your First Acupuncture Visit
item.description:
Your first visit is focused on understanding the full picture of your health, not just one symptom. Expect a detailed conversation about your current concerns, medical history, sleep, digestion, stress, and lifestyle.

Typical first-visit flow

  1. Intake and health history review
  2. TCM assessment, including pulse and tongue evaluation
  3. Acupuncture treatment during the same visit
  4. Home-care recommendations for the days after treatment

Most initial visits are about 90 minutes. Follow-up sessions are usually around 60 minutes.

item.title: Fertility-Focused Supplement Guidance
item.description:
If you are trying to conceive, it is easy to feel overwhelmed by supplement advice online. Many plans are complicated, expensive, and not tailored to your needs.

Our approach is simpler: prioritize real food, consistent routines, and targeted supplementation only when clinically appropriate.

Our supplement philosophy

  • Use evidence-informed recommendations, not social media trends
  • Personalize based on cycle history, labs, and overall health profile
  • Avoid “kitchen sink” stacks that add cost without clear benefit
  • Reassess over time instead of locking into a fixed long list

Important safety reminder

Always consult your physician or a registered dietitian before adding new supplements, especially if you are using fertility medications, preparing for IVF, or currently pregnant.

item.title: Fertility Acupuncture FAQ
item.description:
Is acupuncture a cure for infertility?

No. Acupuncture is not a cure for infertility, but it can be an effective part of a broader fertility care plan.

How can acupuncture support fertility?

Depending on your case, acupuncture may help regulate menstrual cycles, improve blood flow to reproductive organs, reduce stress, and support hormone balance.

Can acupuncture be used with IUI or IVF?

Yes. Many patients use acupuncture alongside assisted reproductive care. Timing and frequency are personalized based on your treatment calendar.

item.title: About
item.description:
Founded in 2022

Harmony Acupuncture Clinic was founded in 2022 to bring thoughtful, patient-centered Traditional Chinese Medicine care to the western suburbs of Chicago. From day one, the clinic has focused on listening deeply to each patient and building treatment plans that fit real life.

We support patients with acute and chronic pain, women’s health concerns, fertility goals, stress and sleep disorders, and whole-body wellness care. Each visit is designed to restore balance physically and emotionally.
